body.p:
Dixon Ky March 20th 1863
Hon Jas F Robinson
Gov, of the Comth, of Ky,
Dear Sir

I have the honor herewith to transmit to you a petition signed 113 citizens of Webster county praying your excelency to remit a fine of $2000 against the Cobb we for sellin Liquor without licens I am happy to inform you that to my knowledge from conversing with Esqr John H. Burrgass & N. N, Johnson that the statements contained in the petition are true you will perceive that Burrgass & Johnson have both asigned the petition which evinces the fact that the statements there contained are true --

I wish to state to you the additional fact that Cobb is a very ignorant man that he can neither read nor write & that he is a quiet inofensive citizen & that he is very poor -- & is a weakly man -- he says that the his family were in need & that he did what he did for the purpose of obtaining necessaries for them I believe the above facts are true & hope that your excellency will remit the same --
P, S, please take this matter under consideration & write to me upon the Subject at the earliest posible convenience address

Webster Cir Ct
$20. } Selling liquor
Micager Cobb
Remit the fine in this case
J F Robinson
Issd Apr 20. 1863
